trans-unit.source: C# streaming wordcount Hadoop sample | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: C# streaming wordcount Hadoop sample | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to write MapReduce programs in C# that use the Hadoop Streaming interface, and how to run them on HDInsight using PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: How to write MapReduce programs in C# that use the Hadoop Streaming interface, and how to run them on HDInsight using PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: Hadoop provides a streaming API to MapReduce, which enables you to write map and reduce functions in languages other than Java.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop provides a streaming API to MapReduce, which enables you to write map and reduce functions in languages other than Java.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to write MapReduce programs in C# by using the Hadoop Streaming interface and how to run the programs in Azure HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to write MapReduce programs in C# by using the Hadoop Streaming interface and how to run the programs in Azure HDInsight by using Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this tutorial apply only to Windows-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this tutorial apply only to Windows-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For an example of streaming for Linux-based HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Develop Python streaming programs for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an example of streaming for Linux-based HDInsight clusters, see <linkText>Develop Python streaming programs for HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the example, the mapper and the reducer are executables that read the input from <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> (line-by-line) and emit the output to <linkText>stdout[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In the example, the mapper and the reducer are executables that read the input from <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> (line-by-line) and emit the output to <linkText>stdout[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The program counts all of the words in the text.
trans-unit.target: The program counts all of the words in the text.

trans-unit.source: When an executable is specified for mappers, each mapper task launches the executable as a separate process when the mapper is initialized.
trans-unit.target: When an executable is specified for mappers, each mapper task launches the executable as a separate process when the mapper is initialized.

trans-unit.source: As the mapper task runs, it converts its input into lines, and feeds the lines to the <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.
trans-unit.target: As the mapper task runs, it converts its input into lines, and feeds the lines to the <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.

trans-unit.source: In the meantime, the mapper collects the line-oriented output from the stdout of the process.
trans-unit.target: In the meantime, the mapper collects the line-oriented output from the stdout of the process.

trans-unit.source: It converts each line into a key/value pair, which is collected as the output of the mapper.
trans-unit.target: It converts each line into a key/value pair, which is collected as the output of the mapper.

trans-unit.source: By default, the prefix of a line up to the first Tab character is the key, and the remainder of the line (excluding the Tab character) is the value.
trans-unit.target: By default, the prefix of a line up to the first Tab character is the key, and the remainder of the line (excluding the Tab character) is the value.

trans-unit.source: If there is no Tab character in the line, entire line is considered as the key, and the value is null.
trans-unit.target: If there is no Tab character in the line, entire line is considered as the key, and the value is null.

trans-unit.source: When an executable is specified for reducers, each reducer task launches the executable as a separate process when the reducer is initialized.
trans-unit.target: When an executable is specified for reducers, each reducer task launches the executable as a separate process when the reducer is initialized.

trans-unit.source: As the reducer task runs, it converts its input key/values pairs into lines, and it feeds the lines to the <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.
trans-unit.target: As the reducer task runs, it converts its input key/values pairs into lines, and it feeds the lines to the <linkText>stdin[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.

trans-unit.source: In the meantime, the reducer collects the line-oriented output from the <linkText>stdout[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.
trans-unit.target: In the meantime, the reducer collects the line-oriented output from the <linkText>stdout[stdin-stdout-stderr]</linkText><title></title> of the process.

trans-unit.source: It converts each line to a key/value pair, which is collected as the output of the reducer.
trans-unit.target: It converts each line to a key/value pair, which is collected as the output of the reducer.

trans-unit.source: By default, the prefix of a line up to the first Tab character is the key, and the remainder of the line (excluding the Tab character) is the value.
trans-unit.target: By default, the prefix of a line up to the first Tab character is the key, and the remainder of the line (excluding the Tab character) is the value.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Hadoop Streaming interface, see <linkText>Hadoop Streaming[hadoop-streaming]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Hadoop Streaming interface, see <linkText>Hadoop Streaming[hadoop-streaming]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will learn how to:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell to run a C# streaming program to analyze data contained in a file in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell to run a C# streaming program to analyze data contained in a file in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Write C# code that uses the Hadoop Streaming interface.
trans-unit.target: Write C# code that uses the Hadoop Streaming interface.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To run the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: To run the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions to open the Azure PowerShell console window, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:
trans-unit.target: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to define the MapReduce job:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to define the MapReduce job:

trans-unit.source: The parameters, specify the mapper and reducer functions and the input file and output files.
trans-unit.target: The parameters, specify the mapper and reducer functions and the input file and output files.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to run the MapReduce job, wait for the job to complete, and then print the standard error message:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to run the MapReduce job, wait for the job to complete, and then print the standard error message:

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to display the results of the word count:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to display the results of the word count:

trans-unit.source: Note that the output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.
trans-unit.target: Note that the output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.

trans-unit.source: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.
trans-unit.target: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce program uses the cat.exe application as a mapping interface to stream the text into the console and the wc.exe application as the reduce interface to count the number of words that are streamed from a document.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce program uses the cat.exe application as a mapping interface to stream the text into the console and the wc.exe application as the reduce interface to count the number of words that are streamed from a document.

trans-unit.source: Both the mapper and reducer read characters, line-by-line, from the standard input stream (stdin) and write to the standard output stream (stdout).
trans-unit.target: Both the mapper and reducer read characters, line-by-line, from the standard input stream (stdin) and write to the standard output stream (stdout).

trans-unit.source: The mapper code in the cat.cs file uses a <linkText>StreamReader[streamreader]</linkText><title></title> object to read the characters of the incoming stream to the console, which then writes the stream to the standard output stream with the static <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method.
trans-unit.target: The mapper code in the cat.cs file uses a <linkText>StreamReader[streamreader]</linkText><title></title> object to read the characters of the incoming stream to the console, which then writes the stream to the standard output stream with the static <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method.

trans-unit.source: The reducer code in the wc.cs file uses a <linkText>StreamReader[streamreader]</linkText><title></title> object to read characters from the standard input stream that have been output by the cat.exe mapper.
trans-unit.target: The reducer code in the wc.cs file uses a <linkText>StreamReader[streamreader]</linkText><title></title> object to read characters from the standard input stream that have been output by the cat.exe mapper.

trans-unit.source: As it reads the characters with the <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method, it counts the words by counting spaces and end-of-line characters at the end of each word.
trans-unit.target: As it reads the characters with the <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method, it counts the words by counting spaces and end-of-line characters at the end of each word.

trans-unit.source: It then writes the total to the standard output stream with the <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method.
trans-unit.target: It then writes the total to the standard output stream with the <linkText>Console.Writeline[console-writeline]</linkText><title></title> method.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you saw how to deploy a MapReduce job in HDInsight by using Hadoop Streaming.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you saw how to deploy a MapReduce job in HDInsight by using Hadoop Streaming.
